body.name: Toshiba X300 4TB Performance & Gaming 3.5-Inch Internal Hard Drive – CMR SATA 6 GB/s 7200 RPM 256 MB Cache - HDWR440XZSTA
body.stockDetail: Only 3 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 18 hrs 6 mins
features: Designed for gaming PC and high-end desktop workstations
High Performance with 7200 RPM and large cache size
Massive capacity to accommodate large gaming libraries
Toshiba's cache technology to deliver high-level performance in real time
Ramp loading technology and shock sensor for reliability
body.description: The Toshiba X300 Performance Internal Hard Drive is designed for professional systems, home media computers, and gaming PCs. The X300 Hard Drive offers 7200 RPM, large cache size, and Toshiba Cache Technology to take your gaming to the next level along with massive capacity to store your growing gaming library. Plus, the X300 comes with data protection technologies to help mitigate vibrations and improve tracking accuracy all of which means more reliability than ever for backing up your digital content. Put the extreme performance, capacity, and reliability of the Toshiba X300 Performance Internal Hard Drive behind your game and graphics intensive projects. [Note]: (1) One Terabyte (1TB) means 10{12] = 1,000,000,000,000 bytes using powers of 10. Actual formatted storage capacity may vary. For details, please visit Toshiba's Consumer HDD website. (2) Compatibility may vary depending on user’s hardware configuration & operating system. (3) Product specifications, colors, configurations and components are subject to change without notice. (4) "2.5-inch" & "3.5-inch" mean the form factor of HDDs. They do not indicate drive's physical size. (5) For "Drive Bays Supported", please contact your Solutions Provider as compatibility with host device will vary based on the system. (6) Workload is a measure of the data throughput of the year, and it is defined as the amount of data written, read or verified by commands from the host system. (7) MTTF (Mean Time to Failure) is not a guarantee or estimate of product life; it is a statistical value related to mean failure rates for a large number of products which may not accurately reflect actual operation. Actual operating life of the product may be different from the MTTF. (8) Read and write speed may vary depending on the host device, read and write conditions, and file size. (9) Drive life may vary depending on usage and workload. (10) Standard limited warranty terms apply. The warranty brochure can be viewed at Toshiba's Consumer HDD website.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Key Features Built for the Pro Whether you’re a PC gamer, video editor, or graphic designer, the X300 hard drive offers the capacity and performance that the pros demand. With up to 18 TB(1) of capacity to store your growing game libraries and HD content, you can keep all your creations without worrying about running out of space. Designed to Up Your Game The last thing gamers and production artists want is lag - the X300 hard drive delivers 7200 RPM speed and up to 512 MB cache size for a responsive experience when loading games or large multimedia files. Plus, Toshiba’s cache technology helps optimize cache allocation during read/write cycles to help provide high drive performance in real time. Data Protection The X300 hard drive’s internal shock sensor and ramp-loading technology help protect your drive and data from harm - so you can play, edit, animate and create as much as you like, without worrying about the safety of your content.

Toshiba X300 Performance Internal Hard Drive Push your gaming and creative limits with the speed, reliability, and capacity of the Toshiba X300 Performance Internal Hard Drive. Optimized to handle high-end graphics and videos, the X300 hard drive is designed to minimize buffering and help eliminate lag so you can be on your game, every time.

Powerful Performance 7200 RPM speed with large cache size designed for gaming & high-end desktop PCs. Powered by CMR recording technology. Massive Capacity Store your growing gaming libraries & HD content with up to 18 TB(1). Accurate & Responsive Drive stabilization technology* helps improve tracking accuracy during read/write operations and Toshiba’s cache technology delivers real-time drive performance. (*Available on select models only) Reliable & Durable Ramp loading technology & built-in shock sensors to help protect your content. Supports MTTF up to 600K hours(7). Powerful Performance Massive Capacity Accurate & Responsive Reliable & Durable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works perfect. Using it as a backup to my main hard drive because my computer is ten years old. I will move to whatever new computer I get. Still using my old PC. Hard drive has been good with no errors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Fast Storage Option
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this drive (4TB X300) for about 7 months now. It's speedy for a hard drive, enough that other than when it needs to spin back up from sleep, I don't feel the comparatively slower speeds in most uses, although I primarily use it for data storage and save gaming/applications for SSDs. It can be a little noisy in use but it's silent at idle, which is where it spends most of its time. CMR is a huge plus and I'm glad Toshiba not only offers that, but advertises it as well, so you don't have to hunt spec sheets (or user-reported specs!). The price is imo competitive, with CMR, 256MB cache, and 7200 RPM. Similar capacity drives can be had for less but will perform slower and less reliably.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It does the job
reviews.reviewText: The only comment I really have on this drive is I've had thousands of drives in my history and this is probably the noisiest drive I've ever had I've tested it and everything seems to be checking out but it is still really noisy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mostly great at two months
reviews.reviewText: Have not noticed any noisy operation as mentioned by a few reviewers. This one was made in Philippines. I don't know whether they manufacture or simply assemble there. Since I'm using a nine year-old Linux box, can't get full rated performance out of the drive but it is fast enough for my uses (with one exception). On standard Ext4 Partitions, I get very decent read and write speeds, around half of the rated spd for the drive. Running LUKS encrypted Partitions, however, write speed is painfully slow. I suspect this is mainly due to issues with the operating system (Debian) and the older computer hardware not handling file transfers well on the encrypted drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great HDD for the money
reviews.reviewText: When it comes to TB per dollar, you still cant beat a hard drive. I put this in one of my friends computers because he's a gamer and he downloads lots of games. Games these days are getting huge so you need a place to store them all. If you don't want to spend $150 for a 4TB SSD, this is where you should be. It's fast enough for most games, reasonably priced, and fairly quiet as well. It seems some folks have gotten HDD's that have been returned or were of a different line of Toshiba HDD's, but I am happy to report my model numbers matched the box and my friend who is a very avid gamer has had no complaints. Recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY FOR GAMING - Received mis-labelled or fraudulent drive
reviews.reviewText: There is something really fishy going on with the drive I bought. It has some sort of terrible APM (power saving features) enabled on a hardware level, which absolutely cripple the performance. I believed Toshiba is either reselling eco drives as gaming drives (very shady) or these drives just have terrible power saving tech integrated, which makes them COMPLETELY unusable for gaming. The drive constantly freezes for several milliseconds while some sort of head parking / spindown operation happens. During games that stream data from the disk (many games) the game will freeze for several frames every 3-5 seconds. Obviously this is unusable. The APM features can be mostly disabled with software, but it is only temporary, and resets when the computer goes to sleep or is restarted. It also doesn't completely disable the APM features, so occasional freezing will still happen at really frustrating moments. I'm guessing one of three things is going on:1. The drives have "eco" tech or "green" tech that is not advertised in the product listing, despite the drive being labelled as "high performance" and ready for pc gaming. (very shady)2. I received a different eco / green type drive that was relabeled and re-sold as a high performance / gaming drive. (fraudulent)3. I received a counterfeit drive (least likely, but maybe possible)I'm surprised I haven't seen more people complaining about the APM features, I'm guessing a lot of people just use this for mass storage and not for gaming. As a pure mass storage drive, it is okay, but unbelievably loud, easily the loudest drive I've ever seen. I replaced it with a WD Black which is almost silent in comparison. Needless to say, DO NOT buy this Toshiba drive for gaming. I spent $190 for this and now I'm stuck with a completely useless for gaming hard drive. If you buy one, test it thoroughly before the return window closes. Unfortunately it is really hard to test for APM features, because it will not become obvious during normal benchmarks, and only becomes visible during specific games or workloads.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money.
reviews.reviewText: It's fast.I had no trouble installing it, though I did have an issue getting it to register, but only because I forgot to set it up in my BIOS.Transfer rate is excellent (especially considering it's a standard HDD, not an SSD).I would buy it again, although I'll probably never need that much storage again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars easy install, fast and quite
reviews.reviewText: I' have 1TB drives from Toshiba and they work fine, but for a family of gamers I needed a bigger drive, so I get this and I'm so glad I did. Easy install, fast and quiet, you won't be disappointed. Plus, Toshiba drives are cheaper than the other name brands.
Great drive for games that aren't data intensive or a place to just store games instead of redownloading them. It's working fantastically for me so far and it's been a year I think.
Awesome speed and size, especially for the price I got it for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for home PC use, but somewhat loud
reviews.reviewText: Great price for the amount of storage and speed you get. I'm running two in RAID and get near SSD speeds. Only downside is they are somewhat loud when doing operations.Great for keeping steam games or files as the speed is perfect for game loading.
great drive, hope the noise of the read heads is not a early sign of a fail going to happen. Other than that would buy again.

Ya llevo más de un año con este disco y hasta ahora no me ha dado ningún problema, muy buena velocidad de lectura y escritura comparado con otro hdd que tengo, tengo algunos juegos instalados en el y no tarda mucho tiempo en cargarlos, salvo que los juegue en resolución muy alta.
